All Implemented Interfaces:
Either<L,​R>
public class BasicEither<L,​R>
extends java.lang.Object
implements Either<L,​R>

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    <X> X fold​(java.util.function.Function<L,​X> fnl, java.util.function.Function<R,​X> fnr)
    Applies fnl to the left value of this either if this is a left either and returns the result or applies fnr to the right value and returns the result.
    boolean isLeft()
    Returns whether this Either is left.
    boolean isRight()
    Returns whether this Either is right.
    java.util.Optional<L> left()
    Returns an option which will contain a value if this Either is left, else will be empty.
    L leftOr​(L other)
    Returns either the left value of this Either (if it is a left Either) or the given alternate value.
    L leftOrGet​(java.util.function.Supplier<L> fn)
    Returns either the left value of this Either (if it is a left Either) or the value returned by the given function.
    L leftOrThrow()
    Returns either the left value of this Either (if it is a left Either) or throws an EitherUnwrapException.
    <E extends java.lang.Throwable>
    L    		 leftOrThrow​(java.util.function.Supplier<E> fn)
    Returns either the left value of this Either (if it is a left Either) or throws the exception returned by calling the given Supplier.
    <N> Either<N,​R> mapLeft​(java.util.function.Function<L,​N> fn)
    Returns a new Either with the left type mapped to Either.
    <N> Either<L,​N> mapRight​(java.util.function.Function<R,​N> fn)
    Returns a new Either with the right type mapped to Either.
    java.util.Optional<R> right()
    Returns an option which will contain a value if this Either is right, else will be empty.
    R rightOr​(R other)
    Returns either the right value of this Either (if it is a right Either) or the given alternate value.
    R rightOrGet​(java.util.function.Supplier<R> fn)
    Returns either the right value of this Either (if it is a right Either) or the value returned by the given function.
    R rightOrThrow()
    Returns either the right value of this Either (if it is a right Either) or throws an EitherUnwrapException.
    <E extends java.lang.Throwable>
    R    		 rightOrThrow​(java.util.function.Supplier<E> fn)
    Returns either the right value of this Either (if it is a right Either) or throws the exception returned by calling the given Supplier.

    • mapLeft

      public <N> Either<N,​R> mapLeft​(java.util.function.Function<L,​N> fn)
      Description copied from interface: Either
      Returns a new Either with the left type mapped to Either.

      If this Either is left, the function be applied to the left value, else the passed function will be ignored.

      Specified by:
      mapLeft in interface Either<L,​R>
      Type Parameters:
      N - New left type for the returned Either
      Parameters:
      fn - function to apply to the left value if this is a left Either.
      Returns:
      A new either of type <Either, Either>

      Description copied from interface: Either

    • fold

      public <X> X fold​(java.util.function.Function<L,​X> fnl, java.util.function.Function<R,​X> fnr)
      Description copied from interface: Either
      Applies fnl to the left value of this either if this is a left either and returns the result or applies fnr to the right value and returns the result.
      Specified by:
      fold in interface Either<L,​R>
      Type Parameters:
      X - Output type of the fold.
      Parameters:
      fnl - function that will map the value to Either if this is a left either.
      fnr - function that will map the value to Either if this is a right either.
      Returns:
      the value of either fnl or fnr depending on whether this is a left or right either.
